meanings.definition: To produce (something) jointly with another person or group.
meanings.sent1: The students were coproducing a play for the school talent show.
meanings.sent2: The team coproduced a new movie that became a box office hit.
meanings.sent3: The cats were coproducing a hilarious dance video for social media.
meanings.sent4: The artists coproducing a masterpiece painting that captured the essence of nature.
meanings.sent5: The chefs were coproducing a delicious dish that combined flavors perfectly.

meanings.definition: To work together with others in producing something.
meanings.sent1: The neighbors were coproducing a community garden to grow fresh vegetables.
meanings.sent2: The scientists coproduced a groundbreaking research paper on climate change.
meanings.sent3: The puppies were coproducing a cute calendar for charity.
meanings.sent4: The musicians coproducing a symphony that moved the audience to tears.
meanings.sent5: The children were coproducing a colorful mural to brighten up the playground.
